real.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: something that is real exists and is important
real.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: There is a real danger that the disease might spread.
We need to tackle the real problems of unemployment and poverty.
There is no real reason to worry.
real.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: something that is real is actually what it seems to be and not false or artificial
real.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: a coat made of real fur
She had never seen a real live elephant before.
Artificial flowers can sometimes look better than the real thing.
real.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: something that is real actually exists and is not just imagined
real.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The children know that Santa Claus isn’t a real person.
Dreams can sometimes seem very real.
Things don’t happen quite that easily in real life.
real.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: What was the real reason you quit your job?
real.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a real feeling or emotion is one that you actually experience and is strong
real.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: There was a look of real hatred in her eyes.
I got a real sense of achievement when my work was first published.
real.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a real thing has all the qualities you expect something of that type to have
real.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: I remember my first real job.
Simon was her first real boyfriend.
real.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: used to emphasize how stupid, beautiful, terrible etc someone or something is
real.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: Thanks – you’ve been a real help.
The house was a real mess.
real.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: a real increase or decrease in an amount of money is one you calculate by including the general decrease in the value of money over a period of time
real.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: a real increase of 6% in average wages
The average value of salaries has fallen in real terms (=calculated in this way).
real.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: It was real nice to see you again.
real.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: earnings etc that are calculated after including in the calculation the effects of inflation
real.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Their data show that average real earnings of men aged 20-40 in 1987 were lower than in 1974.
